title: How to Make DIY Mason Jar Chandelier

steps.headline: Find a good plank of wood.
steps.description: This will be mounted on your ceiling and will be the place where you will have your chandelier lights suspended. You can use an old shelf or just purchase one.

steps.headline: Visualize your project.
steps.description: Determine how many lights you need. Make some measurements where you intend to mount your chandelier.

steps.headline: Grab a sandpaper or better yet a grinder to smooth the surface of the plank.
Buy a roll of wooden self adhesive furniture sticker.
steps.description:
Cover the whole surface of the plank with the furniture sticker. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut to size and leave no air bubbles on the surface. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/44\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/44\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Get your Mason Jars.
steps.description: Depending on your measurements, determine how many jars you will use on this project.

steps.headline: Mark the center of the cap.
Drill through the lids of the jars.
Obtain a metal tube where the electrical wire can pass through the jar lids.
Buy a lighting kit.
Buy your light bulbs.
Grab you plank of wood once more and make measurements,  mark the place wherein you're going to make holes where the wire will pass through.
Drill the holes.
steps.description: Make sure they are equally distant from each other.

steps.headline: Insert the wires through the holes you made.
steps.description:
Tie the wires into a knot on the other side of the plank, this will help the jars securely suspended. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/26\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/26\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Call an electrician for the wiring, if you have basic knowledge about electrical stuff simply do a series connection.
Attach the end of wires to a power source.
Drill four holes in every corner of the plank.
steps.description: get a long concrete screw and mount your chandelier.

steps.headline: You're done, for a tight budget you now have a new centerpiece for your dining or living room!

sentences: Find a good plank of wood.
This will be mounted on your ceiling and will be the place where you will have your chandelier lights suspended.
You can use an old shelf or just purchase one.
Visualize your project.
Determine how many lights you need.
Make some measurements where you intend to mount your chandelier.
Grab a sandpaper or better yet a grinder to smooth the surface of the plank.
Buy a roll of wooden self adhesive furniture sticker.
Cover the whole surface of the plank with the furniture sticker.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/79\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cut to size and leave no air bubbles on the surface.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/44\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/44\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Get your Mason Jars.
Depending on your measurements, determine how many jars you will use on this project.
Remove the caps.
Mark the center of the cap.
Drill through the lids of the jars.
Obtain a metal tube where the electrical wire can pass through the jar lids.
Use whatever is more accessible to you, you can use an old lampshade holder.
cut them into pieces and use a nut to lock them in place.
Apply adhesive on the cap.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/68\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/68\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Insert the metal tube on the hole on top of the cap.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Thread the nut on the tube and stick it on the cap with adhesive.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/97\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/97\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-9Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Buy a lighting kit.
The number of kits depends on how many jars you will use.
Cut the ends where the plugs are.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/b8\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Insert the wires through the jar lids.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2a\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} You can secure the lighting kit by applying strong adhesive on it or simply tie the wire into a knot.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7f\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-10Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Buy your light bulbs.
Make sure you get 25 watts only.
so it won't heat it too much and crack the jars.
Screw the bulbs into your lighting kit.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e8\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/e8\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Screw the jars to the lids.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/50\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Repeat the process in making the jar lighting, depending how many you intend to use.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9e\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/9e\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet3.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-11Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Grab you plank of wood once more and make measurements, mark the place wherein you're going to make holes where the wire will pass through.
Drill the holes.
Make sure they are equally distant from each other.
Insert the wires through the holes you made.
Tie the wires into a knot on the other side of the plank,  this will help the jars securely suspended.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/26\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/26\/Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-DIY-Mason-Jar-Chandelier-Step-14Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Call an electrician for the wiring, if you have basic knowledge about electrical stuff simply do a series connection.
Attach the end of wires to a power source.
Drill four holes in every corner of the plank.
get a long concrete screw and mount your chandelier.
You're done, for a tight budget you now have a new centerpiece for your dining or living room!
